Description: Shallow green-grey schist bowl: with a flat base and an incurving rim, the interior of the base is slightly countersunk, with scratched inscription on the base, perhaps three signs making-up a personal name.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Prof Walter B Emery
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), 61 and pl. 83, no. 8; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 492.
